sen.j: 洪州宗（こうしゅうしゅう）とは、唐代の禅宗の一派を指す。
sen.e: Koshushu was a Zen sect in the Tang Dynasty.
The Koshu sect (Hongzhou-zong) was a sect of the Zen sect (Chan-zong) in the Tang Dynasty.
The Koshu sect (Hongzhou-zong) was a sect of the Zen sect (Chan-zong) in the Tang Dynasty.

sen.j: 禅宗史において、六祖慧能の南宗禅の系統の中で、南嶽懐譲の後継である馬祖道一に始まる系譜を、その活動拠点である江西省によって、洪州宗と呼ぶ。
sen.e: The history of Zen sect genealogy can be traced from Baso Doitsu, a successor of Nangaku Ejo, and rhe one of schools belonging to Rokuso Eno (sixth leader Eno) of Nanshuzen (the Southern School of Ch'an) called Koshushu, because of the foothold practice in Jiangxi Province.

In the history of the Zen sect, among the branch sects of Nanshu-zen (Nanzong-chan) from the sixth leader Eno (Huineng), the sect, founded by Baso Doitsu (Mazu Daoyi) who was a successor of Nangaku Ejo (Nanyue Huanrang), has been called the Koshu sect after the sect's base Jiangxi-sheng.
sen.cmt: 用語。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: In the history of the Zen sect, among the branch sects of Nanshu-zen (Nanzong-chan) from the sixth leader Eno (Huineng), the sect, founded by Baso Doitsu (Mazu Daoyi) who was a successor of Nangaku Ejo (Nanyue Huanrang), has been called the Koshu sect after the sect's base Jiangxi-sheng.

sen.j: 後世、その系統からイ山霊祐や臨済義玄が出る。
sen.e: Future generations of the sect descending from Koshushu produced Reiyu IZAN and Gigen RINZAI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Izan Reiyu (Weishan Lingyou) and Rinzai Gigen (Linji Yixuan) had studied at the Koshu sect.
Izan Reiyu (Weishan Lingyou) and Rinzai Gigen (Linji Yixuan) had studied at the Koshu sect.

sen.j: イ仰宗と臨済宗として、禅五家七宗の一翼を担うこととなる。
sen.e: Reiyu IZAN formed the Igyo sect and Gigen RINZAI formed Rinzai sect, each contributed to zen gokeshichishu [the five houses and seven schools of Zen (Buddhism)].
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Igyo sect (Weiyang-zong) and the Rinzai sect (Linji-zong), which they had founded, developed as ones of the five houses and seven sects of Chinese Zen.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: The Igyo sect (Weiyang-zong) and the Rinzai sect (Linji-zong), which they had founded, developed as ones of the five houses and seven sects of Chinese Zen.

sen.j: その系譜は、馬祖道一に始まり、『百丈清規』によって禅院の規律を制定した百丈懐海によって、禅宗独自の教団制度を確立した。
sen.e: The genealogy of the school started with Baso Doitsu, then Hyakujo Ekai created disciplines of the Zen temple with the "Hyakujo shingi (The Regulations of Pai-chang)," creating a specific religious community within the Zen sect.

The Koshu sect originated from Baso Doitsu, and Hyakujo Ekai (Baizhang Fuanhai) established the disciplines of the Zen temple with 'the Regulations by Baizhang' and formed an original system of the religious community of the Zen sect.
sen.cmt: 用語。翻訳者が古いピンイン表記を使っていますが、すべて現在の表記に直します。
sen.e: The Koshu sect originated from Baso Doitsu, and Hyakujo Ekai (Baizhang Fuanhai) established the disciplines of the Zen temple with 'the Regulations by Baizhang' and formed an original system of the religious community of the Zen sect.

sen.j: 百丈の下から、潙山霊祐と黄檗希運（黄檗宗）が出て、黄檗希運の門下より臨済義玄が出て、その系統が、潙仰宗と臨済宗に受け継がれることとなる。
sen.e: Reiyu IZAN and Kiun OBAKU of the (Obaku Sect) were students under Hyakujo, then Gigen RINZAI was schooled under Kiun OBAKU, and he communicated their practices to the Igyo and Rinzai sects.

As Izan Reiyu and Obaku Kiun (Huangbo Xiyun) of the Obaku Sect (Huangbo-zong) were students of Hyakujo and Rinzai Gigen was a student of Obaku Kiun, their thoughts were handed down to the Igyo sect and the Rinzai sect.
sen.cmt: 用語。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: As Izan Reiyu and Obaku Kiun (Huangbo Xiyun) of the Obaku Sect (Huangbo-zong) were students of Hyakujo and Rinzai Gigen was a student of Obaku Kiun, their thoughts were handed down to the Igyo sect and the Rinzai sect.
